intro: Tibouchina fulvipilis var. scrobiculata, commonly known as the golden tibouchina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Melastomataceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tibouchina fulvipilis var. scrobiculata is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
